intro: Mentha hirsuta var. lobeliana, commonly known as the woolly mint or lobel's mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and square stems, typical of the mint family. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. This variety is valued for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in herbal teas or as a culinary herb.
